result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: HOMELESS,

1:34 PM Defendant Yathzee D Inman in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Yathzee D Inman. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Competency report was filed on 10/14/2022. Defense does not dispute the findings made in the report that states that the Defendant is competent to stand trial. 

Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant re: right to competency hearing. 

For reasons stated on the record, the court finds that the Defendant is competent to proceed to stand trial. 

Defense requests that the CF case be set for a preliminary hearing, and other cases tag along. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Review hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/17/2022

ADDRESS INFO for Yathzee D Inman
Current: HOMELESS,   (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 6330 W Lisbon Ave Apt 1, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with individuals/Salvation Army listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:19 PM Defendant Yathzee D Inman in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Yathzee D Inman. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defendant has a competency on his other cases.  Atty. Tapia refers to Atty. Rypel regarding competency.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
